author: jgm
content:
An altnerative option would be to use the fact that we already have a top-level object to put the root at the same level as the data i.e. 
```
{
  "root: "0x...",
  "data": [...]
}
```

The good news for this is that it solves all of the concerns.  The bad news is that it could be considered a *slight* corruption of the purpose of the data/metadata split, but there's a fair argument that the root is indeed metadata rather than data.
